definition: lit. to arrange a shelf of flowers/superficial display (idiom)
to arrange/to exhibit/to move to and fro/a pendulum
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
to support/frame/rack/framework/classifier for planes, large vehicles, radios etc

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
to do sth for show/to keep up appearances
flowery of fist with fancy footwork (idiom)/highly embellished and ineffectual/fancy but impractical skills/all show and no go/pugilistic wankery
to sing the high part/to speak fine sounding but empty words (idiom)
all talk and no action (idiom)/to preach what one does not practice/same as 光說不做|光说不做[guang1 shuo1 bu4 zuo4]
to skimp on the job/to work half-heartedly/not to take the job seriously
to show off (loanword, from English "show")/to grandstand/to perform in a stage show
(lit.) to fire blank shots/(fig.) to be all talk and no action/to shoot one's mouth off/to make empty promises
